Package com.quinsoft.zeidon

Provides all the standard classes and interfaces necessary for client applications written in Zeidon.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Activator
    Defines the interface for an activator object that is used to activate OIs.
    Application
    The class for retrieving information about a Zeidon application.
    AttributeInstance
    Represents an attribute value in a Zeidon OI.
    BrowserStarter
    Interface for defining how an object browser can be started.
    CacheMap
    Cache maps are a way to store objects in Zeidon objects in a thread-safe way.
    Committer
    Interface that defines methods used to commit an object to a DB.
    DropTaskCleanup
    Every task keeps track of work that needs to be done when the task is dropped.
    DropViewCleanup  
    EntityCursor
    References the currently selected entity instance in a view.
    EntityInstance  
    EntityIterable  
    EntityIterator<T extends EntityInstance>  
    EventData
    Interface that defines data that can be retrieved by a Zeidon EventListener.
    EventListener
    Used for debugging OI events (like entity deletes).
    GeneratedKey
    A generic value for keys generated by the DB.
    GenKeyHandler  
    ObjectEngine
    This is the main container of all Zeidon objects.
    ObjectEngineEventListener  
    OiSourceSelector
    Determines the Activator and Committer that will be used to activate/commit an OI.
    SelectSet
    An interface for keeping track of selected entities.
    StreamReader
    Used to deserialize (i.e.
    StreamWriter
    Defines the methods needed to write an OI to a stream.
    Task
    All methods operating on a task.
    TaskQualification
    Objects that implement this interface can be used to find a Zeidon task.
    View
    A View is the main interface for manipulating Zeidon data organized in Object Instances (OIs).
    ZeidonException.ExceptionHandler  
    ZeidonLogger
    Extends SLF4J logger with some convenience methods.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractOptionsConfiguration
    Common code for getting activate/commit configuration values from task config.
    ActivateOptions
    Encapsulates all activate options.
    ActivateOptions.ActivateOrder
    Used to specify the ordering used on an activate.
    Blob
    A simple wrapper around byte[] so that it can be treated as a comparable object.
    CommitOptions
    Optional options for commit.
    CompareEntityOptions
    Defines the options that can be used when comparing entities.
    CopyAttributesBuilder
    Convenience class to build flags for setMatchingAttributesByName.
    DeserializeOi
    Encapsulates all options available for activating OI's from streams and offers convenience methods activate() and activateFirst().
    DuplicateOiOptions
    Options to be used by View.duplicateOi()
    EntityCache
    Keeps track of information for an Entity Cache.
    Pagination
    Sets up pagination options to be used as part of an activate.
    SerializationMapping
    Used by the (de-)serializers to map LOD entity/attributes names to different names in the external XML/JSON.
    SerializeOi
    Encapsulates options for writing an OI to a file/writer and includes some convenience methods for performing the write.
    TaskLogger
    A wrapper around slf4j Logger that supports the following: - Messages use String.format() functionality.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ActivateFlags
    Enum of Activate flags.
    CommitFlags
    Enum of commit flags.
    CreateEntityFlags  
    CursorPosition  
    CursorResult  
    EntityConstraintType
    List of possible EntityConstraint types.
    EntityCursor.CursorStatus  
    EventNotification
    This is used to give the application notification of different OI events.
    IncludeFlags
    List of options available when including a subobject.
    Level
    Designates the different levels for view names.
    ObjectConstraintType  
    SetMatchingFlags
    Flags used for calling setMatchingAttributesByName.
    StreamFormat
    Stream formats that are supported automatically by Zeidon OI (de-)serialization.
    WriteOiFlags  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DuplicateRootException
    Thrown when committing a new root entity triggers a duplicate key error.
    HiddenAttributeException
    This exception is thrown when an application attempts to reference a hidden attribute by name.
    HiddenCursorException  
    InvalidAttributeConversionException  
    InvalidAttributeValueException  
    InvalidComparisonException
    Thrown when an attempt is made to compare an attribute with an incompatible type.
    InvalidTaskException
    This exception is thrown when code tries to use a view that belongs to a task that has been dropped.
    InvalidViewException  
    MaxCardinalityException  
    NullCursorException
    An attempt was made to access a cursor that is null.
    ObjectConstraintException  
    OutOfScopeException
    An attempt was made to access a cursor that is out of scope.
    PessimisticLockingException
    Thrown by activates if the DB can't acquire a pessimistic lock for an OI.
    RequiredAttributeException
    Thrown by validateSubobject(), this indicates a required attribute is null.
    RequiredEntityMissingException  
    SubobjectValidationException  
    TemporalEntityException  
    UnknownApplicationException  
    UnknownAttributeDefException  
    UnknownEntityDefException  
    UnknownLodDefException  
    ZeidonDbException  
    ZeidonException
    The base exception class for all Zeidon-specific exceptions.

Package com.quinsoft.zeidon Description

Provides all the standard classes and interfaces necessary for client applications written in Zeidon.

Implementations of these interfaces are usually created by an Object Engine or a Task created by an Object Engine. Here is a simple example: 

 
 ObjectEngine oe = JavaObjectEngine.getInstance();
 Task zencas = oe.createTask( "ZENCAs" );
 View view = zencas.activateEmptyObjectInstance( "mUser" );
